Name: Double Statuette of Amenhotep the Third with God Amun
Description: This statuette represents King Amenhotep the Third wearing the Khepresh crown of ceremonies and holding the Heka scepter of kingship in his left hand. He is wearing the Shendyt royal kilt. Behind him is the god Amun-Re on a larger scale. Both of them wear the Usekh wide collar. The deity places his hands on the shoulders of the king to show support for him as king of Egypt.
